Pre-Game Insights: Ghana, a four-time Africa Cup of Nations champion seeking to rebound from a recent slump, will face a Malian team that is the bookmakers' favourite to top Group I of the 2026 World Cup qualifiers.

Both teams enter the game with some of their star players. Ghana will be without captain Andre Dede Ayew, while Mali will miss Tottenham midfielder Yves Bissouma, who is still recovering from an injury sustained during the season.
Mamadou Fofana and Salim Diankate have received their first call-ups and hope to make their international debuts in this match.
Ghana's squad includes two new players, Ibrahim Sulemana and Brandon Thomas-Asante, who hope to make their debuts and contribute to a victory for Ghana.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Black Stars of Ghana departed for Mali on Tuesday, June 5, 2024, and arrived on the same day to continue preparations for the match on Thursday, June 6, 2024.
According to football data outlets like AIscore, Ghana and Mali have met 10 times, with the Black Stars winning five times and Mali winning three.
